head.title: The Court's Term Is Over, but Not the Discord

hedline.hl1: The Court's Term Is Over, but Not the Discord

block.p: Re ''Supreme Court Backs Boy Scouts in Ban of Gays From Membership'' (front page, June 29):
Re ''Supreme Court Backs Boy Scouts in Ban of Gays From Membership'' (front page, June 29):

I am an Eagle Scout and also a retired Presbyterian clergyman, and I know from my scouting that the phrase ''morally straight'' from the Scout Oath refers to sound character, to be applied equally to all persons, gay or straight.

It is a fiction of the present national Scout leadership to construe and subvert the oath to limit its reference to heterosexuals only. By its prejudice and policy of exclusion, the leadership itself fails the ''morally straight'' requirement, and it is sad to see the court giving sanction to that prejudice.
(Rev.) ROBERT B. STUART Amagansett, N.Y., June 29, 2000
